thread.title: Ground News - NYPD officers reflect on two life-saving rescues in exclusive interview
thread.title_full: Ground News - NYPD officers reflect on two life-saving rescues in exclusive interview

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - NYPD officers reflect on two life-saving rescues in exclusive interview
text:
Summary by Ground News Desmond Mohan and Kenly Garcia have been partners at Brooklyn's 76 precinct since 2021. In the last two months, they have made two critical saves. Most recently, this past Tuesday, a 50-year-old man said he felt dizzy and stumbled onto the subway tracks. Share menu More
Filters 1 Articles 1 Articles All Left Center Right
PIX 11 Center High Factuality Media Conglomerate: Mission Broadcasting NYPD officers reflect on two life-saving rescues in exclusive interview BROOKLYN, N.Y. (PIX11) -- When danger is near, two Brooklyn cops never seem to be far away. The partners made two life-or-death saves over the past few months. Bronx business owner stabbed multiple times, perp on the loose: NYPD First, a woman ended up trapped under a pier, and this week when a man suffered a dizzy spell and fell onto the subway tracks. One look at their body cam video, it may seem like officers Desmond Mohan and Ke…
